mng: to erect, vertical, vertical stroke (in Chinese characters)

exm.mng: to erect, to set upright, to stand
to hold up (high), to raise up
vertical, to erect, to set upright, vertical stroke in Chinese characters, young servant (old)
in disorder, at sixes and sevens (idiom)
to prick up one's ears, to strain to hear sth
to pick on sth incessantly, to criticize right and left
exm.pyn: héng tiāo bí zi , shù tiāo yǎn
